newsitem.title: USA: I2 Tech, SAP AG working on distribution agreement. [CORRECTED 08:30 GMT 21/9]
newsitem.headline: I2 Tech, SAP AG working on distribution agreement. [CORRECTED 08:30 GMT 21/9]

text.p: (The company corrects to clarify that a distribution agreement has not yet been signed with SAP).
i2 Technologies Inc is working on a distribution agreement with German software group SAP AG to help boost sales of the two companies' softare systems, i2 executives said.
Vice President of Marketing Robert Humphrey told Reuters he expected an announcement to be made "in the next week or so" but later clarified that no firm deal had yet been signed.
Chief Executive Officer Sanjiv Sidhu said he was confident the deal would go through. "As I understand it, both companies are extremely interested and don't see any roadblocks to getting this done."
The two firms already have a joint-marketing agreement and a joint development project to integrate SAP's client/server software system R/3 with i2's planning and scheduling system, Rhythm.
"The next logical step is a distribution agreement," Humphrey said, adding that the deal would help boost i2's sales, especially in Germany and Europe.
